body.p: The options file has the following format:<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <serialized version="18.1" xml:space="preserve"> <serializableOrderedMap> <entry> <String>author.show.comments</String> <Boolean>true</Boolean> </entry> </serializableOrderedMap> </serialized>An additional entry should be added in this file for each option.

p.ph: Example entry for auto.correct.single.quotes and auto.correct.double.quotes option:

ol.li: Create a term list file (with a .tdi file extension). The name of the file must begin with a two letter prefix that indicates the language it should be attached to, followed by an underscore or hyphen, and then a descriptive name (for example, en_US_myterms.tdi for term list in the US version of the English language or en_myterms.tdi for a less specific English term list). For a list of language codes, see .

In the term list file (.tdi extension), add the terms you want to be included in your custom dictionary. If you need to specify forbidden terms, those words simply need to be preceded by an asterisk. Add one word per row, as in the following example: parabola asimptotic *hyperbola
Save the file (.tdi) to the options/spell folder that is located inside your Oxygen Data Directory (oxygen.data.dir/options/spell).
Restart the server for the spell checker to start using the new terms list.
In Oxygen XML Editor/Author, go to Options Preferences Editor Edit Modes Author AutoCorrect .
Make whatever changes you require and click Apply. If you need help with any of the options in this preferences page, see .
Go to Options Preferences Editor Edit Modes Author AutoCorrect Dictionaries and note the location where the dictionaries are stored.
Navigate to that location with a file explorer and look for a patch file (it should look like: en_patch.xml).
Copy or move that patch file to the options/autocorrect folder that is located inside your Oxygen Data Directory (oxygen.data.dir/options/autocorrect).
Restart the server for the AutoCorrect feature to start using the new terms list.
